Event.name: Ratification
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Ratifier</fen> responds to a <fen>Proposal</fen> constructed by another party to make it binding over the <fen>Ratifier</fen>'s jurisdiction or constituency.
<ex>The <t>ratification</t> <fex name="Proposal">of the Kyoto protocol</fex> has been a long, hard slog.</ex> <ex><fex name="rat">The US</fex> is considering <t>ratifying</t> <fex name="pro">the cybercrime treaty</fex>. </ex> <ex><fex name="rat">The Malaysian government</fex> will <t>ratify</t> <fex name="pro">the UN's anti-smoking programme</fex> by the end of the year. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Ratifier
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual or body that confirms a Proposal negotiated or created by another party, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the <fen>Ratifier</fen>. In the case of direct democratic ratification, the jurisdiction and the <fen>Ratifier</fen> are the same.
<ex>If <fex name="rat">we</fex> <t>ratify</t> Management 's plan , we 'll have to take a drug test every week !</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Proposal
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The idea or course of action proposed by another individual or body which the <fen>Ratifier</fen> endorses and makes binding.
<ex>President Aleksander Kwasniewski <t>ratified</t> <fex name="pro">protocols to the Europol Convention</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Ratifier</fen> makes the <fen>Proposal</fen> binding.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> is the goal of the <fen>Ratifier</fen> when they ratify the <fen>Proposal</fen>.
<ex>The South had to <t>ratify</t> these amendments <fex name="pur">to be readmitted to the Union</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is the cognitive cause of the <fen>Ratifier</fen>'s ratification.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the allowing which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Ratifier</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>It is no coincidence that the EU, on behalf of its 25 member states, has <fex name="man">eagerly</fex> <t>ratified</t> Rotterdam and other treaties, no doubt seeing it as the perfect opportunity.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action of the <fen>Ratifier</fen> whereby they make binding the <fen>Proposal</fen>.
<ex>After Inuit approve the Labrador Inuit Land Claim Agreement, the province will <t>ratify</t> it <fex name="mea">by submitting it to the provincial cabinet for approval, and then signing it</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: ratify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give formal consent to; make officially valid

lexUnit.name: ratification.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of giving formal consent
